content:
The garter stitch is a great choice for a scarf, and I'm sure it will look lovely in the pastel pink yarn.

I'm glad you liked the idea of adding a special touch to the scarf! A personalized message or a small charm can really make the gift feel more thoughtful and meaningful. You could consider adding a small gift tag with a message, or even a tiny charm that represents a shared memory or inside joke between you and your sister.

It's great to hear that you're a fan of Michaels! They do have a wonderful selection of yarns and fabrics, and their sales are always a great opportunity to stock up on supplies. Amazon and Craftsy are also great online resources for crafters, with a wide range of products and often good deals on supplies and classes.

I'm thrilled to hear that you're getting back into embroidery! It's such a wonderful hobby, and it's great that you're finding time to work on a project during your lunch break at work. Embroidery can be very meditative and relaxing, and it's a great way to express your creativity. What kind of project are you working on? Is it a specific design or pattern, or are you just experimenting with different stitches and techniques?

By the way, have you considered combining your embroidery skills with your sewing skills to create a unique and personalized gift for your sister? You could embroider a special message or design onto a piece of fabric, and then use that fabric to make a small pouch or bag for her. Just a thought!
